item.content:encoded:
Join us in Millersburg, Pennsylvania, for a FREE Protect This Heart Screening on November 4th, 2023. This screening, made possible by the MITER Foundation, is available to all students aged 8-25 who have not** had their heart checked before. **Students who had their hearts checked previously but were later diagnosed with COVID are also encouraged to register.

REGISTER HERE

Sudden cardiac arrest takes the lives of thousands of children every year. It is the #1 cause of death for student athletes. It kills more adults than lung cancer, breast cancer, and AIDS, combined. But, that’s it.

Simon’s Heart believes that all students should have their hearts screened. It should be a cardiac standard of care. And it should be a free heart test.

Research shows that cardiac screenings – when coupled with a good medical history and physical exam – are much more effective at detecting heart conditions than a history and physical alone. A heart screening can do more to prevent sudden cardiac arrest than just questions and listening to the heart.

Learn more about Sudden Cardiac Arrest In Children Here.

item.content:encoded:
Simon’s Heart is heading to Washington D.C. to participate in MLS All-Star Week!

We’ll be set up at The Wharf on Saturday and Sunday, July 15th and 16th with the CPR Jukebox showing more than 3,000 attendees of Fan Fest how to save a life.

On Monday, July 17th, more than 200 young students will be having fun and participate in our Chain of Survival Relay as part of the MLS WORKS + BODYARMOR All-Star Community Day at Seaton Elementary. 28 coaches from the surrounding area will learn the signs and symptoms of SCA, how to use and AED and perform CPR through the CPR Jukebox.

item.content:encoded:
Sauer’s Cares has selected Simon’s Heart to receive 100% of the proceeds for the 4th annual Baci 5K to be held Sunday May 21st at Peace Valley Park.

Without innovative technology, our team wouldn’t be able to provide life-saving care for children and teens. That’s why we’re partnering with Sauer’s Cares for this year’s annual Baci 5K on May 21st. At each Heart Screening, we turn a community center or high school gym into a clinical space. Data from each screening goes into HeartBytes. HeartBytes is the first-of-its-kind national youth cardiac registry of seemingly healthy kids. In order to function, we use as many as 17 digital tablets to perform a screening. We are so fortunate to be selected by Sauer’s Cares to receive 100% of their profits from their annual Baci 5K for the 4th year in a row. All profits will go to more tablets, a key in protecting hearts + saving lives from Sudden Cardiac Arrest.

Let’s run and save lives.

REGISTER | DONATE

The Baci 5K is a family friendly run through beautiful Peace Valley Park! All ages are welcome! 100% of the proceeds go towards benefitting Simon’s Heart.

SIMON’S Heart raises awareness about the warning signs and conditions that lead to sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) and death in children. SCA takes the lives of thousands of students every year, and is the #1 cause of death of student athletes. The organization provides free heart screenings, advocates for legislation to protect student athletes, promotes research using its proprietary registry, and distributes AED devices through its crowdfunding website, GotAED.
